comments:
When running SWT Cocoa on 10.4, the VM crashes due to missing support for Obj-C 2.0.

It would be better to put a check in place for 10.4. (or even 10.3?). in order to determine whether or not the OS is supported or not, and then terminate with a JVM Error.
Fixed in HEAD. An exception is thrown when not running in Leopard.

Yup, I've checked this out in HEAD. Nice.

***WARNING: SWT requires MacOS X version 10.5 or greater
***WARNING: Detected: 10.4.9
Exception in thread "main" org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: Not implemented
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3742)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3634)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3605)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.error(Display.java:693)

Interestingly, it detects 10.4.9 but my OS is 10.4.11. I'll raise a separate bug for that.
